alert.note: Alert for John Day Basin (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 12 at 2:51AM PDT until June 14 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN DURING THE DAY SUNDAY WILL CONTINUE TO CAUSE RISES ON CREEKS AND STREAMS... ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Oregon, including the following area, John Day Basin. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate to heavy showers and storms are expected during the day Sunday. 0.5 to 1.0 inches are possible by Monday morning for the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
